snippet: The Devils, who lead their playoff series against the Flyers two games to one, are leaning on old hands like two-time Stanley Cup winner Patrik Elias.
abstract: New Jersey Devils, who lead their playoff series against Philadelphia Flyers two games to one, are leaning on veteran center Patrik Elias, who has appeared in 148 playoff games. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: NEWARK -- Still crafty, versatile and irrepressible at 36, Devils center Patrik Elias played in his 148th Stanley Cup playoff game Thursday. Elias has won it all twice, so he has developed a good sense of timing. And this, he decided, was not quite the right moment to shoot the puck. So, with the Devils on a power play and trailing Philadelphia by a goal, Elias held the puck just long enough to size up Flyers goaltender Ilya Bryzgalov one more time. Elias shot across ice, across Bryzgalov's big body. The puck hit Bryzgalov's blocker and dropped in the goal.

headline.main: Elias Steadies Devils in the Postseason's Tumult
